content:
content

contentcontent model contains a declaration of the intended content model for the element (or other construct) being specified. [22.5 Element Specifications ]

    controls whether or not pattern names generated in the corresponding RELAX NG schema source are automatically prefixed to avoid potential nameclashes.

    Example

    This sample content element indicates that the element being specified has no content:

    <content><empty/></content>
    Content model<content> <alternate> <elementRef key="valList" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <classRef key="model.contentPart" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <anyElement minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded" require="http://relaxng.org/ns/compatibility/annotations/1.0 http://relaxng.org/ns/structure/1.0"/> </alternate> </content>
